item.title: DNA Barcoding
item.description: What is DNA-barcoding? DNA-barcoding is a method that is uses a small section of the DNA to specify an organism. The chosen section has to be unique for every species. It is called barcode because it can be assigned distinctively like a supermarket barcode to a product. DNA stores genetic information like computercode only instead of the numbers 0 and 1 DNA uses four bases as ‘letters’: adenine, thymine, cytosine and guanine.
